Campus Benefits for BYU-Idaho Employees

Please Note:

•  Fees and restrictions apply to some services. 
•  Spouses and dependents of employees are asked to observe the BYU-Idaho Honor Code and
    Dress and Grooming Standards while on campus. (For dress and grooming standards for 
    students, please see www.byui.edu/handbook/ on the internet.)

Activities Calendar                                                                                                     Back to Top

  • The activities calendar, which lists a variety of campus activities, is available on the internet.
  • Web address: http://calendar.byui.edu/  

Bookstore (University Store)                                                                                   Back to Top

  • Open to the public.
  • 10% discount on most items (must show BYU–Idaho ID card).
  • Location: Manwaring Center 142 (496-2211)
  • Web address: www.byui.edu/bookstore/

BYU–Idaho Personal Account                                                                                 Back to Top

  • Each employee has an account on which they can makes charges for BYU-Idaho goods and services.
  • The Accounting Office sends out an electronic statement once per month.
  • Location: Accounting Office, Kimball 130 (496-1057)
  • Web address: www.byui.edu/accountingoffice/

Campus Parking                                                                                                       Back to Top

  • Employees are entitled to one transferable "A" permit (employee parking lots) and one "B" permit (general parking lots). "A" permits are valid in all lots.
  • Parking passes may be obtained through University Security. To get a parking permit you must present your vehicle registration.
  • Location: University Security, Kimball 150 (496-2448)
  • Web address: www.byui.edu/security/

Cell Phones                                                                                                                Back to Top

  • Purchase cell phones for office and/or personal use.
  • Phones may be purchased for family members. (Purchase must be initiated by the employee.)
  • Location: University Store (Bookstore), Manwaring Center 142 (496-2583)
  • Web address: http://www.byui.edu/cellphone/

Continuing Education                                                                                                Back to Top

  • Offers a variety of credit and non-credit courses. (Please note: restrictions apply for tuition waivers for new employees and their families. See "Tuition Benefits" section of this document.)
  • Hosts "Education Week" each Spring. (Open to the public.)
  • Location: Continuing Education, ASB 103 (496-1251)
  • Web address: www.byui.edu/ce/

Copy Centers                                                                                                              Back to Top

  • Open to the public.
  • Black and white copies, color copies, lamination, binding, etc.
  • Location: Manwaring Center (next to the University Bookstore)
  • Location: University Press, ASB 119 (496-2850)
  • Web address: www.byui.edu/press/

Devotional                                                                                                                   Back to Top

  • Broadcast live on KBYI-FM (100.5) at 2:00 p.m. on Tuesdays.
  • Transcripts and audio files of devotionals are located on the BYU–Idaho web page.
  • Web address: http://web.byui.edu/presentations/

DMBA                                                                                                                           Back to Top

  • Provider of health and retirement benefits for full-time employees and their families.
  • Supplemental retirement programs are also available (i.e. 401K). (Employees can invest in programs through DMBA or TIAA-CREF.)
  • DMBA telephone number: 1 (800) 777-3622.
  • Web address: www.dmba.com

Employment Opportunities (on the BYU–Idaho campus)                                     Back to Top

Non-Students Jobs:

  • Job openings are posted on the internet.
  • It is the responsibility of the applicant to keep abreast of job openings and to ask to be considered for specific openings.
  • Location: Human Resources, Kimball 226 (496-1700)
  • Web address: http://www.byui.edu/employment/

Students Jobs:

  • Openings for on-campus jobs.
  • Location: Human Resources, Kimball 226 (496-1700)
  • Web address: http://www.byui.edu/StudentEmployment/

Entertainment                                                                                                              Back to Top

  • Open to the public.
  • Fine arts events, sporting events, etc.
  • Web address - Activities: http://activities.byui.edu/
  • Web address - Campus Calendar: http://calendar.byui.edu/
  • Web address - Center Stage: http://www.byui.edu/centerstage/default.htm
  • Web address - Ticket Office: http://www.byui.edu/tickets/

Family History Center                                                                                                  Back to Top

  • Open to the public.
  • Open Monday thru Saturday, and Sunday afternoons.
  • Location: Mckay Library 220 (496-2386)
  • Web address: www.lib.byui.edu/

Food Court - "Crossroads"                                                                                        Back to Top

  • Open to the public.
  • Location: Manwaring Center – 2nd Floor.
  • Web address: www.byui.edu/foodservices/

Hart Gym                                                                                                                       Back to Top

  • Use of the facilities is restricted to 1) full-time employees 2) full-time employees’ dependants, and 3) part-time employees.
  • P.E. equipment, and lockers are available.
  • Must wear BYU-I approved exercise apparel. See http://www.byuistore.com/c-49-approved-exercise-clothing.aspx for approved clothing and associated prices.
  • Yearly use fees: facilities are free for employees and dependants of full-time employees.
  • Use of facilities: The University gives first priority to University classes and activities.
  • Location: Hart Gym 202 (496-2152)
  • Web address: http://www.byui.edu/activities/resources/exercise-facilities-and-play-fields/hart-building

Human Resources Office                                                                                            Back to Top

  • Provides assistance on employment, benefits, and employee training.
  • Location: Kimball 226 (496-1700)
  • Web address: www.byui.edu/hr/

ID Card                                                                                                                            Back to Top

  • Available to full-time employees and their dependents, and part-time employees.
  • Gives eligible participants check-out privileges at the library, discounts at the bookstore, use of facilities at the Hart Gym, etc.
  • Spouses and dependents (age 8-26) are eligible for an ID card.
  • Location: I-Card Office, Manwaring Center 160 (496-1012)
  • Web address: www.byui.edu/icard/

Information Desk                                                                                                          Back to Top

  • Location: Manwaring Center – 2nd Floor (496-1400)

Library                                                                                                                            Back to Top

  • Open to the public.
  • Check-out privileges for full-time employees and their dependents, and part-time employees. Others may purchase a library card for $20 per year.
  • Location: McKay Library (496-2367)
  • Web address: www.lib.byui.edu

Media Lab                                                                                                                      Back to Top

  • Services available for full-time and part-time employees.
  • Video/DVD services, equipment rentals, slide projectors, etc.
  • Location: McKay Library 320/360 (496-2356)
  • Web address: http://www.byui.edu/insttech/media.htm

Outdoor Equipment Rentals                                                                                        Back to Top

  • Open to the public.
  • Rent sleeping bags, tents, ski equipment, cooking gear, etc. (Call for availability.)
  • Location: Outdoor Resource Center (under the stadium) (496-7337)
  • Web address: http://activities.byui.edu/orc/

Orientation for New Employees                                                                                  Back to Top

  • Each new employee is required to attend three different orientation sessions:

              1) New Employee Orientation (campus information and policies).
              2) Benefits Orientation (health, life, and retirement benefits).
              3) The "Spirit of Ricks" Training (history, mission, and values of BYU–Idaho).

  • Location: Human Resources, Kimball 226 (496-1700)
  • Web address: www.byui.edu/hr/

Planetarium                                                                                                                     Back to Top

  • Open to the public.
  • Presentations are given Thursday evenings at 7:00 p.m.; seating is limited (theater seats 40).
  • Location: Romney Building 107
  • Web address: www.byui.edu/planetarium/

Scroll (Student Newspaper)                                                                                         Back to Top

  • Published once per week.
  • Location: Scroll Office, SPORI 114 (496-2900)
  • Web address: www.byui.edu/Scroll/

Thomas E. Ricks Gardens                                                                                            Back to Top

  • Open to the public.
  • Location: South of the Kimball Building and the Taylor Building.
  • Web address: http://www.byui.edu/applied-plant-science/gardens

Tuition Benefits (for Credit and Non-Credit Courses)                                             Back to Top

  • Restrictions apply (See BYU–Idaho "Professional Development" policy for additional information).
  • Free tuition for spouses (after employee has been working full-time for two years – or one year if employee is 27 years old or older).
  • Free tuition for dependents – up to 76 credits (after employee has been working full-time for two years – or one year if employee is 27 years old or older).
  • Dependents must first be officially admitted to BYU-Idaho (contact the Admissions office).
  • Location: Human Resources, Kimball 226 (496-1700)
  • Web address: www.byui.edu/hr/

University Catering                                                                                                        Back to Top

  • Open to the public.
  • Catering available for office or personal use.
  • Location: Food Services, Manwaring Center 248 (496-2246)
  • Web address: http://www.byui.edu/foodservices/catering/CateringHome.htm


Note for employees of LDS Philanthropies and the Corporation of the Presiding Bishopric:

Applicable benefits at BYU–Idaho include:

  • BYU–Idaho ID card
  • Discount at BYU–Idaho Bookstore (University Store)
  • Library check-out privileges
  • Use of facilities in the Hart Gym
  • Discount tickets for campus events
  • Employee parking permit
